head.note: This manuscript contains: The book of Ezekiel; The book of Ezekiel. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 4 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: The book of Ezekiel
ch. iv. 16 — ch. v. 4, ἐξελεύσεται
msItem.note: See Tischendorf, Monumenta Sacra Inedita, Nova Coll., t. ii., pp. 313—4 , and Prolegomm., pp. xiii. and xliii.

msItem.title: The book of Ezekiel
Ch. v. 4, πῦρ, —11, Διὰ τοῦτο, ζῶ ἐγὼ

physDesc.p: Foll.1, 2, and 5—7 are fragments of a Greek manuscript, written in double columns, with 21 lines on each page. Fol. 1 is a very small fragment, on which only a few letters are visible. The the greater part of the outer columns of fol. 2 has been torn away. Fol. 5 is now much torn. Foll. 6 and 7 are small fragments, on which scarcely any of the original writing is legible. These leaves are palimpsest; cf. the upper text.

item.p: Foll.1, 2, and 5—7 are fragments of a Greek manuscript, written in double columns, with 21 lines on each page. Fol. 1 is a very small fragment, on which only a few letters are visible. The the greater part of the outer columns of fol. 2 has been torn away. Fol. 5 is now much torn. Foll. 6 and 7 are small fragments, on which scarcely any of the original writing is legible. These leaves are palimpsest; cf. the upper text.

handDesc.handNote: The character is a slanting uncial of the viiith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: The martyrdom of Peter of Alexandria; Jacob of Batnae. A discourse of Jacob of Batnae on the End of the World and the Coming of the Antichrist; Eusebius of Emesa. A small portion of a discourse of Eusebius of Emesa on Lent; Isaiah of Scete. An extract from Isaiah of Scete; A fragment containing prooemia and prayers. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 6 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: The martyrdom of Peter of Alexandria

An extract from Isaiah ofScete

physDesc.p: Eleven vellum leaves, all more or less stained and torn. The leaves of the lower text were folded so as to form a volume measuring about 8 3/4 in. by 5 1/2.

handDesc.handNote: Written in a good, regular hand of the xth or xith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Genesis, ch. xxiv. 52—ch. xxv. 6; Numbers, ch. xxii. 18— 36; Numbers, ch. xviii. 17—ch. xix. 4. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 3 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Genesis, ch. xxiv. 52—ch. xxv. 6
Numbers, ch. xxii. 18— 36
Numbers, ch. xviii. 17—ch. xix. 4

physDesc.p: Eleven vellum leaves, all more or less stained and torn, but apparently belonging to the same Coptic manuscript (Add. 14,665, foll. 10—20). Foll. 17—19 are the best preserved, and measure about 11 in. by 8 3/4. The text is written in two columns, of from 33 to 39 lines. Foll. 10—16 are so mutilated, and the ancient writing is so much obliterated, that it is difficult to say, without employing chemical reagents, what portions of Scripture they comprise. Fol. 20 is made up of eight disconnected fragments, merely put together in order to preserve them. This manuscript is palimpsest; cf. the upper text.

item.p: Eleven vellum leaves, all more or less stained and torn, but apparently belonging to the same Coptic manuscript (Add. 14,665, foll. 10—20). Foll. 17—19 are the best preserved, and measure about 11 in. by 8 3/4. The text is written in two columns, of from 33 to 39 lines. Foll. 10—16 are so mutilated, and the ancient writing is so much obliterated, that it is difficult to say, without employing chemical reagents, what portions of Scripture they comprise. Fol. 20 is made up of eight disconnected fragments, merely put together in order to preserve them. This manuscript is palimpsest; cf. the upper text.

handDesc.handNote: Written in a fine, regular character, probably of the vith or viith cent. The dialect is the Sahidic or that of Upper Egypt (الصَّعِيد.

physDesc.p: A vellum leaf, much stained and mutilated. It is palimpsest, but re-written on one side only. The more recent text seems to be part of the same manuscript as the preceding number. The older text, apparently of the xth cent., is too much effaced to be legible.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.quote: (recto, 1st col.)ܘܐܦ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܩܢܘܢܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܒܝܕ % ܐܬܘܬܐ ܩ̇ܠܢܝܬܐ ܕܡܢ ܬܪܝܢ ܫ̈ܩ̣ܠܐ ܡܪ̈ܟܒܐ̣. ܐܢܗܘ ܕܢܫܬܟܚܘܢ ܒܗ ܐܦ ܐܚܪ̈ܢܐ̣. ܟܠܗܘܢ ܢܛ̇ܪܝܢ ܩܢܘܢܐ. ܠܐ ܓܝܪ ܣܒ̇ܪ ܐܢܐ ܕܡܫܬܟܚܝܢ ܒܗ ܣ̈ܓܝܐܐ. ܟܪ%ܩܣܐ. ܟܪ%ܣ%. ܦܠ%ܓܡܐ. ܦܠ%ܓܡ%. ܦܠܓܡܐ ܕܝܢ ܫܡܐ ܝܘܢܝܐ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ̣. ܘܫܘܠܗܒܐ ܡܬܦܫܩ܀ Margin, ΦΛΕΓΜΑ. ΦΛΕΓΜΑΤΑ, in small, neat characters ܏ܟܛ ܏ܩܝܘܢܐ ܏ܕܥܣܪܝܢ..............%......... Illegible rubric. The marginal letters ܟܛ are very uncertain. ܒܗܢܐ ܩܢܘܢܐ ܠܐ ܐܫܬܟܚܘ ܫ̈ܡܗܐ ܕܟܪ̈ܢܝܐ. ܠܐ ܓܝܪ ܠܚ̇ܡ ܗܢܐ ܪܘܟܒܐ ܕܡܢ ܬܪܝܢ ܫ̈ܩ̣ܠܐ ܡܪ̈ܟܒܐ ܠܫܡ̈ܗܐ.........................(2nd col.) ܡܩ̣ܝܡ ܠܗ ܠܩܢܘܢܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܐܝܟ ܐ̇ܝܟܢ. ܪܕܝܦܐ. ܪܕܝܦܬܐ. ܛܪܝܕܐ. ܛܪܝܕܬܐ. ܫܒܝܩܐ. ܫܒܝܩܬܐ. ܪܕ%ܦܐ ܪܕ%ܦܬܐ. ܛܪ%ܕܐ. ܛܪ%ܕܬܐ. ܫܒ%ܩܐ. ܫܒ%ܩܬܐ. ܦܣ%ܩܐ. ܦܣ%ܬܐ. ܡܢ ܗܠܝܢ ܗܟܝܠ ܐܬܝܕܥ̣ܬ̣. ܕܩܢܘܢܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܡܢ (?) ܬܪܝܢ ܫܩ̣̈ܠܐ ܡܪ̈ܟܒܐ ܠܓܢܣܐ ܢܩܒܬܢܝܐ ܠܚ̇ܡ̣. ܘܠܐ ܗܘܐ ܠܕܟܪܢܝܐ. ܚܕ ܕܝܢ ܫܡܐ ܐܫܬܟܚ ܒܗ. ܘܗܢܐ ܢܛ̇ܪ ܠܩܢܘܢܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܓܘܢܝܐ ܕܡܡܠܠܐ ܗܢܐ ܢܗܪܝܐ̣. ܘܒܚܘܠ̇ܦܐ ܕ܏ܐ ܗܲܝ ܕܒܫܘܠܡܗ ܠ%. ܡܬܐ̣ܡܪ ܣܓܝܐܢܐܝܬ. ܕܐܝܟ ܐܝܟܢ. ܦܫ%ܦܫܐ. ܦܫ%ܦܫ%. ܏ܫܠ̣ܡ ܏ܩܢܘܢܐ ܏ܕܥܣܪܝܢ ܏ܘ[ܬܫܥ] ܀ .........................(vers, 1st col.) ܦܥܘܪܡܐ. ܓܠܘܣܩܐ. ܩܛܘܒܠܐ. ܡܣܘܪܩܐ ܀ ܘܬܘܒ ܫܡ̈ܗܐ ܡ̈ܠܬܢܝܐ ܕܡܥܒܕܢܘܬܐ ܘܕܚܫܐ. ܕܠܘܚܝܐ. ܟܪܘܟܝܐ. ܥܪܘܩܝܐ. ܥܠܘܒܝܐ ܀ ܟܠܗܘ̣ܢ ܗܟܝܠ ܫܡ̈ܗܐ ܚ̈ܕܢܝܐ ܦܫ̈ܝܛܐ ܕܟܪ̈ܢܝܐ ܕܒܝܕ % ܐܬܘܬܐ ܩ̇ܠܢܝܬܐ ܕܡܢ ܬܪܝܢ ܫ̣̈ܩܠܐ ܡܪ̈ܟܒܐ: ܘܟܠܗܘܢ ܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܬܘܒ ܡ̈ܠܬܢܝܐ ܕܐܝܬ ܠܗܘܢ ܝ̄ ܒܫ̇ܩ̣ܠܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐܚܪܝܐ ܩܕܡ ܐ̄ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܒܫܘܠܡܗܘܢ ܆ ܒܗ̇ ܒܕܡ̣ܘܬܐ ܠܟܠܗܘܢ ܩܢ̈ܘܢܐ ܡܬܐܡܪܝܢ ܣܓܝܐܢܐܝܬ. ܕܐܝܟ ܐ̇ܝܟܢ. ܦܥ%ܪܡܐ . ܦܥ%ܪܡ%. ܓܠ%ܣܩܐ. ܓܠ%ܣܩ%. ܓܛ%ܒܠܐ (sic). ܩܛ%ܒܠ%. ܡܣ%ܪܩܐ ..........................................(2nd col.)...... ܏ܕܒܝܕ % ܏ܕܡܢ ......The greater part of this rubric is illegible. ܐܦ ܗܢܐ ܬܘܒ ܠܫܡ̈ܗܐ ܢܩܒ̈ܬܢܝܐ ܠܚ̇ܡ̣ ܘܠܐ ܡܫܬܟܚܝܢ ܒܗ ܕܟܪ̈ܢܝܐ ܐܝܟ ܕܐܬ̇ܝܐ ܀ ܡܬܝܕܥܐ ܗܕܐ̣. ܐܢܗ̣ܘ ܕܠܫܡܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܙܥܘܪܐ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܟܘܪܐ ܕܩܕܡܘ ܐܬܬܣܝܡܘ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܣܪܝܢ ܘܚܡܫܐ̇. ܬܥ̣ܒܕ ܢܩܒܬܢܐܝܬ̇. ܕܐܝܟ ܐ̇ܝܟܢ. ܙܥܘܪܬܐ. ܒܟܘܪܬܐ. ܙܥ%ܪܬܐ. ܒܟ%ܪܬܐ. ........................Illegible rubric. ܒܬܪ ܗܠܝܢ ܗܟܝܠ܆ ܏ܦܓ ܩ̈ܢܘܢܐ ܕܫܡ̈ܗܐ ܬܪ̈ܝܢܝ ܫ̈ܩܠܐ ܐّܘ ܪܚ̇ܡ ܥܡܠܐ̣. ܕܢ̇ܬ.............................

physDesc.p: The upper half of a vellum leaf, which formed part of the same manuscript as Add. 17,217, foll. 37 and 38 . It can therefore only be deciphered with difficulty.

item.p: The upper half of a vellum leaf, which formed part of the same manuscript as Add. 17,217, foll. 37 and 38 . It can therefore only be deciphered with difficulty.

additions.note: N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.p: On fol. 28a, is written in the margin, ΦΛΕΓΜΑ. ΦΛΕΓΜΑΤΑ, in small, neat characters
Unfortunately the greater part of one column on each side has been covered with rude Arabic writing.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Syro-Arabic garshunography in East Syriac script

revisionDesc.change: CHANGED: added or corrected folio extent values
ADDED: added missing locus information for msItems
CHANGED: updated incorrect form and/or material support designation
ADDED: supplied and corrected Syriaca.org URIs for authors
